newsitem.title: ITALY: FORECAST-Italy seen issuing 16-16.75 trln lire BOT.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Italy seen issuing 16-16.75 trln lire BOT.

text.p: The Italian Treasury is expected to pursue its recent policy of issuing fewer short term bills (BOT) than are maturing and more zero coupon certificates (CTZ), a Reuter poll of analysts showed.

Analysts expect that at the September auction, the Treasury will issue 250 million to one billion lire worth less BOTs than the 17 trillion lire worth maturing. They expect it to issue some two to 2.5 trillion lire of CTZ.

Some said the Treasury might try to issue less six month paper after a poor performance at the last auction on August 27. At this auction the Treasury offered 13.75 trillion lire of six month BOTs but received bids for only 13.56 trillion lire.
This was the first time a short term bill auction was not fully covered but analysts said this was due to technical factors and overall was more than adequately covered.
The Treasury will detail the amounts it will offer at auction on Friday and paper will be auctioned on Wednesday September 11.
